p: Sudarsan et al. [ 7] optimized an eco-friendly approach to synthesize AgNPs using endophytic bacteria ( Cytobacillus firmus) isolated from the stem bark of Terminalia arjuna. These silver nanoparticles effectively inhibited bacterial growth in a dose-dependent manner. Results of this study showed good antimicrobial and antifungal activities against Gram-positive ( Staphylococcus aureus) and Gram-negative ( Escherichia coli) bacteria, as well as pearl millet blast disease-causing fungi ( Magnoporthe grisea). They also described the role of endophytic secondary metabolites in metal reduction, stabilization, and capping of silver nanoparticles.
